messages.body: hey kevin - is your client preview still up?
Couple of questions about the creative upload form...
Your sample has product and campaign as separate selects -- was it your intent that selecting a product would dynamically set the options in the campaign select?
I've drafted a better user flow which I was going to talk through a bit during our call today and then send over
You have a checkbox "allow other googlers to add to this campaign" -- should that only show if the user is creating a new campaign from this form?
Hopefully it'll assist in those user stories
Correct. I believe our JS logic might not account for it but the checkbox itself should only be available to a user if the campaign they're assigning creative to is something that is new.
Anthony? I'm not sure I actually have the credentials to get into basecamp. I'm getting the emails, but I can't log in.

Another question -- on the upload form, if you create a new campaign, the Run Date fields would seem to preclude the user from entering a range that crosses a year boundary, say 2012 Q4 and 2013 Q1. How should we handle that situation?
For the run dates - we're thinking each quarter is essentially a checkbox that corresponds to each year
in the form we have javascript that reveals a new year input when you type in the previous one
so it would look like that when selecting 2012 Q4 and 2013 Q1
Oh -- I didn't notice that. Okay
Anthony is away at the moment but I'll make sure he takes a look at your Basecamp account  -- I don't have admin access
weird that you can get on campfire but not basecamp
Hey Noel.. Give this link a shot https://nelsoncash.basecamphq.com/id/invitations/7f9ed9e06f4b4a1a4356b503a58eb5d7
Where is the JS code that tiles the image assets on the index page?
Updated the readme on our repo to give a rundown of the assets and what they're controlling here: https://github.com/nelsoncash/nc-google-creative-library
What I have right now is the index page, but the assets are staying one per row, they aren't tiling -- what don't I have wired in?
is there something I have to do to enable isotope?
You'll also need hoverintent.6.js too.. sorry
Okay, I see all the pieces, something is just not being called.
Isotope is called based on main.js around line 39
Maybe you don't have the correct HTML structure?
No, the structure is fine. It was just calling isotope on load, but the assets were coming in from a subsequent ajax call. I've got it now
I'm going to grab some lunch
feel free to pull down our most recent changes
we populated a random set of creatives that may help you guys tweak the layout
post pull you'll want to run:
then got this on rake db:migrate
sure want me to paste the full trace?
haha right that would help wouldn't it
(the newrelic thing is a warning that shouldn't ultimately break anything)
Shall we light the machine on fire?
put it out with a fatboy and take a nap
try rails server and then add a campaign (if you can)
that route just directs me back to http://localhost:3000/home
ok so I added a campaign
and so this is the expected result? http://cl.ly/image/2D0j412V0Z1K
the images should conform to the sizes we target
though the randomness may be introducing unrealistic ugliness
but we figured it was worth letting you guys look at
yep definitely something we need to figure out
what's the recommended way to intercept the click event so that we can update the lightbox?
I have the click event wired to open the light box, but I need to put the relevant data into the lightbox.
The triggers themselves are passed as data attributes on the anchors themselves
Which triggers the show event on the modal.
We need to do something before the modal shows, though, to update the lightbox itself.
We could write a click event in js that then fires the modal through js rather than on the data attribute
Pushed a minor change to masonry for the homepage grid
You guys want to grab a quick call later on today or possibly tomorrow morning?
Actually.. we have that standup tomorrow morning. ;)
just figuring we can regroup on the whole "what can be integrated for Friday" during the standup tomorrow
Okay. We got much of the index page integrated today
Who should be the technical contact name on the rackspace account?
Looks like Rdio is going to get into video http://www.vdio.com/
Ha oh hey Erik.. Just realized I posted this in here.. sup
this is where I go for news
are we able to add our own content to that login page?
The google account page? I've never seen other content there
well i suppose that page is only to select from accounts i am logged into
but im referring to this page: http://cl.ly/image/1y1J390W2p3G
I'm not sure. If you have, like, a mail server running via google apps, I think you can get to it
hm ok -- we're hoping to be able to deliver a page sort of like http://cl.ly/image/172X2r3m3R0d the gmail login page, that explains what the app is, etc.
so when a non-logged in user directs to the app they are redirected to the login page, instead of the home page here http://cl.ly/image/0P1r35162q1u
whcih would make it feel like more of an internal app
just trying to figure out the viability of a flow like that
Right. I don't know, seems like you should be able to do something.
not immediately urgent to know right now, I'll post a message to everyone on Basecamp
I just pushed up the download manager to the repo
All the corresponding CSS an JS was updated as well. The Haml can be found in the raw_haml views folder
Hey dudes.. Where should I drop the haml file for the media player?
I got some fpo media files too that could go along with it so you could see it working and what not
Pardon, Anthony: a few notes about rackspace
can we make matt@tablexi.com the contact?
You can send him the credentialing info whenever
I've set him as the technical contactâ€¦ hmm
I would think so.. Did you get an email last week?
not that I can find at the moment
Let me give rackspace a ring to see whats up
I'd rather not give out the primary user/login
it's possible that matt can give them his ssh key
that would help for shell based provisioning, though he may still need access to the rackspace website
just asked him; he'll need access to the web account however Rackspace can provide it, either as technical or primary contact
Let me see what I got
It appears that it is not possible to have multiple username/password logins for the cloud admin panel
This won't allow us to pass our Google security requirements
The only thing Rackspace offers at the moment is a wholesale share of the account which offers full access
I see. We'll discuss the ramifications and regroup shortly
Cool. I'm going to double check with the Google security document as well.
We could possibly have to look into going to one of the other providers you gave us in the previous list.
The raw HAML and js dependencies for the Media Player have been pushed to the repo
Follow up question from this morning -- on the index page for video files, we're showing a preview image, for audio files, should we show the audio icon?
We also list .ai and .psd as possible file types, or are those just source files?
.pdf, .ai and .psd should be generating thubnails, correct?
This thread should have those details https://nelsoncash.basecamphq.com/projects/10187349-creative-library/posts/68679244/comments#comment_205296263
I think so, it doesn't quite match the code so far. Will you have icons do display for the other formats?

well I believe the only non-visual items that need a thumbnail are audio files. We'll be adding validation to the upload form that tells a user html, txt, js, indd, indb, etc. can only be uploaded as source files
Though we will need some representation of the source-only file on the creative show and creative edit pages

right - I think for those we will be adding smaller icons that will be added as css sprites - so if we can have some appropriate css classes for each file listing we can take it from there. Anthony is working on getting the styles for the "Source File" section in the wireframe - http://cl.ly/image/0u1w1n2e391N ready to go.
having trouble getting the migration to seed random creatives to run
that should do it - i'll try locally
this is what it spat out at me
this is with the latest and greatest code I assume?
Oh, that's probably a debug statement I left in
Latest-er and greatest-er. Now with uploading audio files. Probably.
Can I put a link to the creative edit page in the index page lightbox?
As long as we could move it / assign a class .. etc at some point
and thats also a link that is only visible to the current user with permission to edit that creative
we had a quick question about the order of css files piping in
the way we wrote the sass, every page should only load style .scss, which imports all the other files in as partials
and it is doing that fine in the app, but
then it also loads the partials in after the style.scss file, which is causing some minor weirdness in the styling
do we just remove the  *= require_tree . line from the application.css file ?
we can take a closer look if it's still acting up
removing that line appears to work, we just weren't sure if it has effect on anything else
that should be ok - we can add more files explicitly if needed at any point

Question about the filters on the creative page -- it seems like if somebody chooses "none" for any of the subfilters, that would automatically mean the query would return nothing. Do we want to return nothing or not send the request until the user actually chooses something?

I'd say not send the request until the user actually chooses something. The reason there is a 'none' selection is to make it easy for a user to go from a list with everything selected to a list with only one filter selected.
All would send since items will be selected.
Having a little bit of a timing issue getting the send to happen after the processing of the "all", but I'll figure it out
By the way, was working on a "No Results" page for the creative listing -
say if a user filters a combination that there are no results for somehow
would we be able to add a link that resets the entire set of filters, and also one that undos the last filer action?

i figured something like that, I'll make a post with this to basecamp for your stories. At the very least we just need a no results message, the reset and undo are nice-to-haves if we have time but probably not do or die for mvp
Any ideas as to why a css transition would 'freeze' during an ajax request?
I've seen something similar, it's possible that something is getting confused if ajax requests overlap.
I'll test some more.. Good to know
Dunno, I'll look at it more tomorrow
I just removed some duplicate ajax that may have caused bugginess
Take a look if you guys get a moment
Having some issues getting my local machine up and running
So far I've done a db:migrate and generate_random_creatives
that will generate the stock set of run dates
No problem -- there was a difference in the range of dates in your front end and the range we had in the basic setup
Twitter is having a service outage at the moment. https://status.github.com/
That one's on me - I fixed but can't push to github
in the meantime you can replace filterable:line 6 with:
Hey guys.. Just added support for our media grid to now have all fade transitions css based rather than JS
Should be a good performance enhancement
Do you have HTML copy for the email that we send out for notifying a new user?
no we dont - something we're working on
we will be providing an html template for you to send
Follow up question -- on the form, there's a checkbox for "notify via email" -- what would we do if they don't check that box?
Looks like that checkox makes no sense, I think we'll remove it
Anthony, what did you try to upload?
We attempted a few file formats: JPG, PDF, and PNG
I see. I have an idea what it might be, but I need John to look at the production setup.
Cool. Just keep me posted. Thanks for looking into it
Looks like you got something up there
I'm going to have Uri double test it
But it looks good on my end at the moment
Okay -- it was an issue with the server environment, not the code
Also includes a Rails security patch
What's the issue that you are seeing?
The specified file we have isn't able to actually be processed as a piece of creative and displayed on the production environment
I do see a version of that image on production -- different format?
It seems to be based on the filename
The ticket says you can't upload the file at all in production?
What did you change it to that worked on staging?
the file name on DoneDone has dashes, the file name in the attachment to Subha has spaces, which is the one you had a problem with?
The one in the email Subha has
DD changed the filename it looks like
So, we think spaces in the filename cause problems?
I didn't think of it.. But it could be
I got a filename with spaces successfully on staging
Hmmâ€¦ that particular file fails for me locally, which is good, actually, because then I can diagnose
It's not the spaces. It's actually even more embarrassing.
It's not recognizing the file because the extension is capitalized
So our file-type-picker code was not interpreting it properly
Could have sworn I had tested that one
But I can see in the code that it doesn't normalize when it checks file extension for type, and when I fixed it, it does. I'm going to push to staging momentarily
Cool. Once on staging I can test
I'm going to have Uri test. If all is well we can schedule a production deployment?
Just so we have our ducks in a row. Can we schedule a production deployment tomorrow AM?
Great. Anytime before 12 would be great. I'm flexible.
Just let me know what time we're scheduled?
Anthony, is the only fix the change to the header?
Great. Any ideas as to when today it would deploy?
I'd expect soon. I'll let you know
Just make sure it happens today is all. I believe we've communicated that to others as well.
